post.Title: Java desktop links of the week, August 13
post.Content:
Hi all, here's another weeks worth of links. Enjoy and keep up the hard work!

JavaFX

  • There are a couple of JavaFX enterprise posts this week. Firstly, over at OTN there is an article about Oracle WebLogic RESTful Management Services 'from command line to JavaFX'.
  • The other enterprise post this week is by Matthieu Brouillard in a post titled 'FXML & JavaFX powered by CDI & JBoss Weld'.
  • Thierry Wasyl has started work on a new BreadcrumbBar control that might wind its way into JFXtras Labs soon. You can see a video of it in its early stages.
  • Chika Okereke has posted about applying slide transitions in JavaFX. If you're going to JavaOne in San Francisco you can also go and see a talk on PDF to JavaFX conversion.
  • If you can understand German, Tom Schindl has given a talk about his e(fx)clipse project.
  • Per Lundholm has blogged about how to go about creating an analog clock in JavaFX.
  • I interviewed Daniel Zwolenski about his involvement with JavaFX.

Catch you all next week :-)
